Sport Wikipedia Sport From Wikipedia free encyclopedia Jump navigation Jump search Forms competitive activity usually physical other uses see Sport disambiguation Sport in childhood Association football shown above team sport which also provides opportunities nurture physical fitness social interaction skills Sport includes all forms competitive physical activity games which through casual organised participation aim use maintain improve physical ability skills while providing enjoyment participants in some cases entertainment spectators Hundreds sports exist from those between single contestants through those with hundreds simultaneous participants either in teams competing as individuals In certain sports such as racing many contestants may compete simultaneously consecutively with one winner in others contest match between two sides each attempting exceed other Some sports allow tie draw in which no single winner others provide tie breaking methods ensure one winner one loser number contests may be arranged in tournament producing champion Many sports leagues make an annual champion by arranging games in regular sports season followed in some cases by playoffs Sport generally recognised as system activities which are based in physical athleticism physical dexterity with largest major competitions such as Olympic Games admitting only sports meeting this definition other organisations such as Council Europe using definitions precluding activities without physical element from classification as sports However number competitive but non physical activities claim recognition as mind sports International Olympic Committee through ARISF recognises both chess bridge as bona fide sports SportAccord international sports federation association recognises five non physical sports bridge chess draughts checkers Go xiangqi limits number mind games which can be admitted as sports Sport usually governed by set rules customs which serve ensure fair competition allow consistent adjudication winner Winning can be determined by physical events such as scoring goals crossing line first It can also be determined by judges are scoring elements sporting performance including objective subjective measures such as technical performance artistic impression Records performance are often kept popular sports this information may be widely announced reported in sport news Sport also major source entertainment non participants with spectator sport drawing large crowds sport venues reaching wider audiences through broadcasting Sport betting in some cases severely regulated in some cases central sport According T Kearney consultancy global sporting industry worth up billion as world s most accessible practised sport running while association football most popular spectator sport Contents Meaning usage Etymology Nomenclature Definition Competition History Fair play Sportsmanship Cheating Doping drugs Violence Participation Gender participation Youth participation Disabled participation Spectator involvement Amateur professional Technology Politics As means controlling subduing populations Religious views Popularity See also References Further reading External links Meaning usage Etymology word sport comes from Old French desport meaning leisure with oldest definition in English from around being anything humans find amusing entertaining Other meanings include gambling events staged purpose gambling hunting games diversions including ones that require exercise Roget s defines noun sport as an activity engaged in relaxation amusement with synonyms including diversion recreation Nomenclature singular term sport used in most English dialects describe overall concept e g children taking part in sport with sports used describe multiple activities e g football rugby are most popular sports in England American English uses sports both terms Definition See also Game Definitions International Olympic Committee recognises some board games as sports including chess Show jumping an equestrian sport precise definition separates sport from other leisure activities varies between sources closest an international agreement on definition provided by SportAccord which association all largest international sports federations including association football athletics cycling tennis equestrian sports more therefore de facto representative international sport SportAccord uses following criteria determining that sport should have an element competition be in no way harmful any living creature not rely on equipment provided by single supplier excluding proprietary games such as arena football not rely on any luck element specifically designed into sport They also recognise that sport can be primarily physical such as rugby athletics primarily mind such as chess Go predominantly motorised such as Formula powerboating primarily co ordination such as billiard sports primarily animal supported such as equestrian sport inclusion mind sports within sport definitions has not been universally accepted leading legal challenges from governing bodies in regards being denied funding available sports Whilst SportAccord recognises small number mind sports it not open admitting any further mind sports has been an increase in application term sport wider set non physical challenges such as video games also called esports especially due large scale participation organised competition but these are not widely recognised by mainstream sports organisations According Council Europe European Sports Charter article i Sport means all forms physical activity which through casual organised participation aim at expressing improving physical fitness mental well being forming social relationships obtaining results in competition at all levels Competition are opposing views on necessity competition as defining element sport with almost all professional sport involving competition governing bodies requiring competition as prerequisite recognition by International Olympic Committee IOC SportAccord Other bodies advocate widening definition sport include all physical activity instance Council Europe include all forms physical exercise including those competed just fun In order widen participation reduce impact losing on less able participants has been an introduction non competitive physical activity traditionally competitive events such as school sports days although moves like this are often controversial In competitive events participants are graded classified based on result often divided into groups comparable performance e g gender weight age measurement result may be objective subjective corrected with handicaps penalties In race example time complete course an objective measurement In gymnastics diving result decided by panel judges therefore subjective are many shades judging between boxing mixed martial arts victory assigned by judges if neither competitor has lost at end match time History Main article History sport Roman bronze reduction Myron s Discobolos nd century AD Artifacts structures suggest sport in China as early as BC Gymnastics appears have been popular in China s ancient past Monuments Pharaohs indicate that number sports including swimming fishing were well developed regulated several thousands years ago in ancient Egypt Other Egyptian sports included javelin throwing high jump wrestling Ancient Persian sports such as traditional Iranian martial art Zourkhaneh had close connection warfare skills Among other sports that originated in ancient Persia are polo jousting Motorised sports have appeared since advent modern age Electronic sports are recent development wide range sports were already established by time Ancient Greece military culture development sport in Greece influenced one another considerably Sport became such prominent part culture that Greeks created Olympic Games which in ancient times were held every four years in small village in Peloponnesus called Olympia Sports have been increasingly organised regulated from time ancient Olympics up present century Industrialisation has brought increased leisure time letting people attend follow spectator sports participate in athletic activities These trends continued with advent mass media global communication Professionalism became prevalent further adding increase in sport s popularity as sports fans followed exploits professional athletes all while enjoying exercise competition associated with amateur participation in sports Since turn st century has been increasing debate about whether transgender sportspersons should be able participate in sport events that conform with post transition gender identity Fair play Sportsmanship Main article Sportsmanship See also Gamesmanship Winning isn t everything it s only thing Sportsmanship an attitude that strives fair play courtesy toward teammates opponents ethical behaviour integrity grace in victory defeat Sportsmanship expresses an aspiration ethos that activity will be enjoyed its own sake well known sentiment by sports journalist Grantland Rice that it s not that won lost but played game modern Olympic creed expressed by its founder Pierre de Coubertin most important thing not winning but taking part are typical expressions this sentiment Cheating See also Match fixing cheating Key principles sport include that result should not be predetermined that both sides should have equal opportunity win Rules are in place ensure fair play but participants can break these rules in order gain advantage Participants may cheat in order unfairly increase chance winning in order achieve other advantages such as financial gains widespread existence gambling on results sports fixtures creates motivation match fixing participant participants deliberately work ensure given outcome rather than simply playing win Doping drugs Main article Use performance enhancing drugs in sport competitive nature sport encourages some participants attempt enhance performance through use medicines through other means such as increasing volume blood in bodies through artificial means All sports recognised by IOC SportAccord are required implement testing programme looking list banned drugs with suspensions bans being placed on participants test positive banned substances Violence Violence in sports involves crossing line between fair competition intentional aggressive violence Athletes coaches fans parents sometimes unleash violent behaviour on people property in misguided shows loyalty dominance anger celebration Rioting hooliganism by fans in particular problem at some national international sporting contests Participation Gender participation International level female athletes at ISTAF Berlin This section needs expansion can help by adding it March See also Women s sports Women s professional sports Women s sports in United States Female participation in sports continues rise alongside opportunity involvement value sports child development physical fitness Despite gains during last three decades gap persists in enrollment figures between male female players Female players account total participation in US interscholastic athletics Gender balance has been accelerating from increase in increase in Hessel full citation needed Youth participation This section needs expansion can help by adding it March See also College sport Youth sport presents children with opportunities fun socialisation forming peer relationships physical fitness athletic scholarships Activists education war on drugs encourage youth sport as means increase educational participation fight illegal drug trade According Center Injury Research Policy at Nationwide Children s Hospital biggest risk youth sport death serious injury including concussion These risks come from running basketball association football volleyball gridiron gymnastics ice hockey Youth sport in US billion industry including equipment up private coaching Disabled participation runner gives friendly tap on shoulder wheelchair racer during Marathon International de Paris Paris Marathon in See also Disabled sports Disabled sports also adaptive sports parasports are sports played by persons with disability including physical intellectual disabilities As many these are based on existing sports modified meet needs persons with disability they are sometimes referred as adapted sports However not all disabled sports are adapted several sports that have been specifically created persons with disability have no equivalent in able bodied sports Spectator involvement Spectators at unofficial Olympic Games Main article Spectator sport competition element sport along with aesthetic appeal some sports result in popularity people attending watch sport being played This has led specific phenomenon spectator sport Both amateur professional sports attract spectators both in person at sport venue through broadcast media including radio television internet broadcast Both attendance in person viewing remotely can incur sometimes substantial charge such as an entrance ticket pay per view television broadcast It common popular sports attract large broadcast audiences leading rival broadcasters bidding large amounts money rights show certain fixtures football World Cup attracts global television audience hundreds millions final alone attracted an estimated worldwide audience well over million Cricket World Cup Final attracted an estimated audience million in India alone In United States championship game NFL Super Bowl has become one most watched television broadcasts year Super Bowl Sunday de facto national holiday in America viewership being so great that in advertising space was reported as being sold at m second slot Amateur professional Women s volleyball team U S university See also professional sport amateur sport Sport can be undertaken on an amateur professional semi professional basis depending on whether participants are incentivised participation usually through payment wage salary Amateur participation in sport at lower levels often called grassroots sport popularity spectator sport as recreation non participants has led sport becoming major business in its own right this has incentivised high paying professional sport culture high performing participants are rewarded with pay far in excess average wages which can run into millions dollars Some sports individual competitions within sport retain policy allowing only amateur sport Olympic Games started with principle amateur competition with those practised sport professionally considered have an unfair advantage over those practised it merely as hobby From Olympic athletes were allowed receive compensation sponsorship from IOC decided make all professional athletes eligible Olympics with exceptions boxing wrestling Technology These lights at Melbourne Cricket Ground indicate decision third umpire makes following review Technology plays an important part in modern sport With it being necessary part some sports such as motorsport it used in others improve performance Some sports also use it allow off field decision making Sports science widespread academic discipline can be applied areas including athlete performance such as use video analysis fine tune technique equipment such as improved running shoes competitive swimwear Sports engineering emerged as discipline in with an increasing focus not just on materials design but also use technology in sport from analytics big data wearable technology In order control impact technology on fair play governing bodies frequently have specific rules that are set control impact technical advantage between participants example in full body non textile swimsuits were banned by FINA as they were enhancing swimmers performances increase in technology has also allowed many decisions in sports matches be taken reviewed off field with another official using instant replays make decisions In some sports players can now challenge decisions made by officials In Association football goal line technology makes decisions on whether ball has crossed goal line not technology not compulsory but was used in FIFA World Cup in Brazil FIFA Women s World Cup in Canada as well as in Premier League from Bundesliga from In NFL referee can ask review from replay booth head coach can issue challenge review play using replays final decision rests with referee video referee commonly known as Television Match Official TMO can also use replays help decision making in rugby both league union In international cricket an umpire can ask Third umpire decision third umpire makes final decision Since decision review system players review decisions has been introduced used in ICC run tournaments optionally in other matches Depending on host broadcaster number different technologies are used during an umpire player review including instant replays Hawk Eye Hot Spot Real Time Snickometer Hawk Eye also used in tennis challenge umpiring decisions Politics Main article Politics sports This section needs additional citations verification Please help improve this article by adding citations reliable sources Unsourced material may be challenged removed Find sources Sport news newspapers books scholar JSTOR May Learn remove this template message Sports politics can influence each other greatly Benito Mussolini used FIFA World Cup which was held in Italy showcase Fascist Italy Adolf Hitler also used Summer Olympics held in Berlin Winter Olympics held in Garmisch Partenkirchen promote Nazi ideology superiority Aryan race inferiority Jews other undesirables Germany used Olympics give itself peaceful image while it was very actively preparing war apartheid was official policy in South Africa many sports people particularly in rugby union adopted conscientious approach that they should not appear in competitive sports Some feel this was an effective contribution eventual demolition policy apartheid others feel that it may have prolonged reinforced its worst effects In history Ireland Gaelic sports were connected with cultural nationalism Until mid th century person could have been banned from playing Gaelic football hurling other sports administered by Gaelic Athletic Association GAA if she he played supported Association football other games seen be British origin Until recently GAA continued ban playing football rugby union at Gaelic venues This ban also known as Rule still enforced but was modified allow football rugby be played in Croke Park while Lansdowne Road was redeveloped into Aviva Stadium Until recently under Rule GAA also banned members British security forces members RUC from playing Gaelic games but advent Good Friday Agreement in led eventual removal ban Nationalism often evident in pursuit sport in its reporting people compete in national teams commentators audiences can adopt partisan view On occasion such tensions can lead violent confrontation among players spectators within beyond sporting venue as in Football War These trends are seen by many as contrary fundamental ethos sport being carried on its own sake enjoyment its participants very famous case sport politics collided was Olympics in Munich Masked men entered hotel Israeli olympic team killed many men This was known as Munich massacre study US elections has shown that result sports events can affect results study published in Proceedings National Academy Sciences showed that home team wins game before election incumbent candidates can increase share vote by percent loss had opposite effect effect greater higher profile teams unexpected wins losses Also Washington Redskins win final game before an election then incumbent President more likely win if Redskins lose then opposition candidate more likely win this has become known as Redskins Rule As means controlling subduing populations tienne de La Bo tie in his essay Discourse on Voluntary Servitude describes athletic spectacles as means tyrants control subjects by distracting them Do not imagine that any bird more easily caught by decoy nor any fish sooner fixed on hook by wormy bait than are all these poor fools neatly tricked into servitude by slightest feather passed so speak before mouths Truly it marvelous thing that they let themselves be caught so quickly at slightest tickling fancy Plays farces spectacles gladiators strange beasts medals pictures other such opiates these were ancient peoples bait toward slavery price liberty instruments tyranny By these practices enticements ancient dictators so successfully lulled subjects under yoke that stupefied peoples fascinated by pastimes vain pleasures flashed before eyes learned subservience as na vely but not so creditably as little children learn read by looking at bright picture books Religious views foot race was one events dedicated Zeus Panathenaic amphora Kleophrades painter circa BC Louvre museum Sport was an important form worship in Ancient Greek religion ancient Olympic Games called Olympiad were held in honour head deity Zeus featured various forms religious dedication him other gods As many Greeks travelled see games this combination religion sport also served as way uniting them practice athletic competitions has been criticised by some Christian thinkers as form idolatry in which human beings extol themselves adore themselves sacrifice themselves reward themselves Sports are seen by these critics as manifestation collective pride national self deification in which feats human power are idolized at expense divine worship Tertullian condemns athletic performances his day insisting entire apparatus shows based upon idolatry shows says Tertullian excite passions foreign calm temperament cultivated by Christian God has enjoined us deal calmly gently quietly peacefully with Holy Spirit these things are alone in keeping with goodness His nature with His tenderness sensitiveness Well shall this be made accord with shows show always leads spiritual agitation since pleasure keenness feeling giving pleasure its zest keenness feeling rivalry giving in turn its zest that Then have rivalry have rage bitterness wrath grief with all bad things which flow from them whole entirely out keeping with religion Christ Popularity Popularity in major sports by size fan base Sport Fans Sphere Association football billion Global Cricket billion UK Commonwealth Field hockey billion Europe Africa Asia Australia Tennis billion Global Volleyball million Western Europe North America Table tennis million Global Basketball million Global Baseball million United States Caribbean Japan Rugby million UK Commonwealth Golf million Western Europe East Asia North America See also Sports portal Outline sports List sports List sportspeople List sports attendance figures
